subject: Re: A convention to be kept?
msgSnippet: Forgive me if I phrased that in a confusing way. POTATO S 3¤ will hopefully never be correct. The day it does will be the day German rules are applied to
messageBody:
Forgive me if I phrased that in a confusing way. "POTATO'S 3¤"
will hopefully never be correct. The day it does will be the day
German rules are applied to English. How about "ihtsch" for each?

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Wayne Cornelius"
<wayne_cornelius@...> wrote:
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "tim_rice09" <tim_rice09@>
> wrote:
> >
> >
> > The apostrophy works well in T.O. to show the difference
between
> > plural, possesive and plural possesive case. It was recently
pointed
> out
> > to me that even in phonetic writing it would still be usefull.
In the
> > Quickscript manual it is used in abbreviations like he'd and
he'll
> > though I am yet to find a place where it marks plurals.
>
> Using apostrophes to mark PLURALS isn't supposed to be done
in /any/
> English writing! It's grammatically improper (see "Greengrocers'
> apostrophes" in your search engine).
>
